Cryptonite-TP
Webpage on how NGOS become the saviors of the victims in harsh situations

<body>
    <h1><b><i><u>The Heroes Who Helped in Times of Crisis: NGOs</u></i></b></h1>
    <p>In this blog, we will be talking about the heroes who with their tireless efforts helped those in dire need. Their efforts often go unnoticed behind the headlines, yet they are the ones at the front offering humanity. </p>
    <ol>
        <li><b><h3>Assam Floods:</h3></b></li>
        <p>
            The Assam Floods of 2022 led the people to believe they were caught in turmoil. These floods were quite devastating. Heavy rains made the Brahmaputra river overflow resulting in the sweeping away of not only crops but also animals, homes, and people. On getting informed about this, Nirmaan collaborated with local organizations and volunteers to help and assist with the situation. They launched the "India Floods Relief Project - Operation Sahaaya 7.0" and raised over 61+ Lakh to help the affected. They have also distributed Back-to-Home Relief Kits, costing Rs. 1800 each to 1000 underprivileged families, including mosquito repellents, medicines, ration, hygiene items, etc. This has helped the affected with their monthly needs and basic supplies.
        </p>
        <img src="https://th-i.thgim.com/public/incoming/vi5lun/article65557565.ece/alternates/LANDSCAPE_1200/Assam%20floods%20Silchar.jpg" height="250" width="400">
       
        <li><b><h3>Covid-19:</h3></b></li>
        <p>
            The second wave of Covid-19 caused widespread damage, putting a lot of pressure on healthcare workers and resources. There weren't enough frontline workers or oxygen, and more ICU beds were needed. To help, HYSEA and Nirmaan Organization worked together. HYSEA got help from companies like Microsoft and Qualcomm, raising 18 crores. Nirmaan found seven hospitals in urgent need and provided ventilators, beds, and oxygen cylinders. This teamwork showed how working together can solve big problems during emergencies. It proved that when businesses and non-profit group organizations cooperate, they can make a real difference in emergencies.
        </p>
        <img src="https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/proxy/_hqesV327apghyZcw6CyNpIGK5nSqArxGaFzVNkZFkCO9CS_b7W8ahN_grFdg_sHUy8xRWXfDaQVG1TwAzSaP0z2mGGXMcs_G4xxd9IJ" height="250" width="400">
        <div>----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------</div>
        
        <li><b><h3>Himalayan Floods:</h3></b></li>
        <p>
            The calamity was triggered by heavy rainfall and cloudbursts. This disaster occurred on August 14, 2023, resulting in the tragic loss of 72 lives and 20 individuals reported missing. Before the event, the weather department issued a red alert due to the intense rainfall. The Red Cross Society, an NGO, was among the initial responders during the crisis. Additionally, the Indian Air Force played a major role in rescuing approximately 2000 individuals. Both the Red Cross Society and the government extended their unwavering support to the affected population by providing medical assistance and organizing the distribution of essential supplies such as food, water, and shelter.
        </p>
        <img src="data:image/jpeg;base64," height="250" width="400">
        <div>----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------</div>
        
        <li><b><h3>Cyclone Biparjoy:</h3></b></li>
        <p>
            In the case of Cyclone Biparjoy, a threatening cyclone emerged in the east-central Arabian Sea on June 6th, 2023, and raged for an extensive 13-day period until June 19th, 2023. The cyclone resulted in the loss of 17 lives and injuries to 24 individuals. The coastal village of Jakhau, Gujarat experienced a landslide, causing widespread devastation to fishing boats, electricity poles, homes, properties, and agricultural lands. Responding swiftly to the crisis, NGOs such as SEEDS India, GOONJ, Centre for Environment Education (CCE), and Bal Raksha Bharat, extended aid to over 1 Lakh affected individuals, providing not just essential needs but also catering to the specific needs of infants and the elderly. Recognizing the psychological toll on survivors, these organizations established support camps to offer crucial psychological assistance to those suffering severe trauma.
        </p>
        <img src="https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcQmKJjetQH51AjoQmG0AwzCdo101jONE86Aog&s" height="250" width="400">
        <div>----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------</div>
        
        <li><b><h3>Andhra Pradesh train collision:</h3></b></li>
        <p>
            This accident dated October 29, 2023, was caused due to the negligence of two companion drivers. It resulted in the loss of 14 passengers' lives and injuries to over 50 passengers. The driver and his fellow companion driver were distracted by a cricket match, leading to the collision between two trains at 7:00 pm that day. The Rayagada passenger train hit the Visakhapatnam Palasa train. NGOs and some local organizations supported the affected individuals and communities by providing immediate relief such as food, shelter, and medical aid. 
        </p>
        <img src="https://images.moneycontrol.com/static-mcnews/2023/10/Andhra-train-accident-770x433.png?impolicy=website&width=770&height=431" height="250" width="400">
        <div>----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------</div>
    </ol>
